author: News On February
title: Chanel Lewis confesses to murdering New York jogger Karina Vetrano - Yahoo7
text:
Share Chanel Lewis confesses to murdering New York jogger Karina Vetrano - Yahoo7 The man accused of killing a New York jogger in Queens has reportedly confessed to police that he strangled the woman because he “had some issues at home”. Close Man charged with murder of New York jogger UP NEXT VIDEO More than six months after Karina Vetrano was murdered, NYPD claim they have received a confession from 20-year-old Chanel Lewis. Source: Reuters Man charged with murder of New York jogger 
The New York Post revealed that Chanel Lewis, 20, told detectives he murdered Ms Karina Vetrano on the side of a path in Howard Beach, Queens on August 2, 2016. 
“I was angry. I had some issues at home. I just lost it. When I saw her, I just hit her and kept hitting her. I hit her and choked her,’’ Lewis said, according to a source quoted in the New York Post. 
More than six months after the Queens woman was murdered, NYPD Chief of Detectives Robert Boyce said that Lewis had made “very detailed, incriminating statements” but in the end it was the 30-year-old victim that helped them solve her murder. Chanel Lewis has been accused of murdering New York jogger Karina Vetrano. Source: Reuters & Instagram Karina Vetrano was captured running with black spandex shorts moments before she was sexually assaulted. Source: Crime Watch Daily Mourners carry the casket of Karina Vetrano from St. Helen's Church following her funeral. Source: AAP 
“She had the DNA under her nails, she had touch DNA on her back, and there was more DNA on the cellphone,” Detective Boyce added 
With his wrists handcuffed behind his back, Lewis stood in the Queens Criminal Court in silence before the victim’s emotional mother, Cathie Vetrano, let rip at the accused. 
“A savage murderer! He f g murdered my daughter, my beautiful innocent daughter, now your nightmare begins,” she screamed. 
“He’s a demon, he should be in hell and burn in hell.”
